citeinfo.origin: Sandra Thiel--Idaho Department of Water Resources
citeinfo.title: regional_watershed_huc5-6-7

descript.abstract: The fifth field watershed coverage consists of watersheds approximately 50,000 acres in size. The coverage is complete at the fifth field level for all hydrologic units within Idaho. Major contributors to watershed deliniation include the Bureau of Land Management, U.S. Forest Service, Idaho Department of Lands, Boise Cascade Corporation, and the Idaho Deparment of Water Resources. This coverage also contains sixth and seventh field watersheds where they are available. However, much of the state remains undefined at that scale.
descript.purpose: To create a standardized set of line work for use by state, federal and local agencies. We want a coverage that can be certified by both USGS and NRCS as well as local users.
descript.supplinf: IDWR watershed page is available at www.idwr.state.id.us/gisdata/gis.htm. NRCS info is at http://www.ftw.nrcs.usda.gov/huc_data.html. The USGS http://wwwga.usgs.gov/gis/iag.html. USGS and NRCS have created a new standard which is scheduled to be final in October 2000.

idinfo.accconst: None with the understanding that this is a draft
idinfo.useconst: There are scale variations. Some of the line work was digitized at a scale of 1:1000,000. Others were done at 1:24,000. This is a draft coverage. Linework and attribute information may change. When the final federal watershed delineation standards are released, changes will may be made to linework and attribute information to bring the coverage into compliance.

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows 2000 Version 5.0 (Build 2195) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 8.1.0.642

attracc.attraccr: Because this is a draft coverage, there may some inconsistancies in the attribute information. An initial check was done to make sure that reasonable attribute information is present within the fields submitted, but no check has been done to make sure that duplicate field names or numbers do not occur or to make sure that the basin name correctly reflects the watershed. These checks will be done before the coverage is released as a final coverage. If errors are found, please submit them to sthiel@idwr.state.id.us and she will coordinate updates with the agency that contributed the data.

dataqual.logic: Polygon and chain-node topology present. No label errors. Normal ArcInfo polygon file with polygon and line attributes.
dataqual.complete: Incomplete - in progress. Many of the forests have submitted watersheds as fine as the sixth field. However, much of the state remains at the fifth field level. As coordination occurs with other states and agencies, the linework and attribute information will change.

horizpa.horizpar: The horizontal accuracy may vary widely within this coverage. Some of the original lines were screen digitized with 1:100,000 scale hydrography to approximate watershed delineations. Some of the lines have been digitized at the 1:24,000 scale and are within 1:24,000 map accuracy standards. Check the source attribute on the linework for the information about a specific line.
